comment: Enjoyable, understanding prof. Gave good feedback, yet rubrics were almost nonexistent. I'd email him questions for nearly every assignment and it was tedious. When there was a rubric, it was sometimes hidden in another module or in the syllabus. Still, would take again and the class material was engaging enough. Final research proposal, no final.

When it comes to knowing what he wants in the class there is absolutely no guidance. The instructions are very vague and grading is harsh. There is harsh feedback when it comes to the papers but not much direction. Most of the time the instructions were confusing.

Took this course online and it was very boring. His instructions for papers are broad and vague, but he's a tough grader and leaves little feedback. His lectures were boring- I skimmed over the chapters instead. If you're willing to put in the work, you'll be okay!
Dr. Logan loves to give out very broad and vague instruction and then precedes to grade like you have been doing research experiments all your life and there is no room for error.

I took Prof Logan for Research Methods and yes it is true that the class itself sucks, however, Professor Logan made it bearable. He is extremely kind and you can tell he tries to make the class as interesting as it can be. Group work and lots of papers but if u ask him for help he helps u out so much so don't be afraid to talk to him!!
